meanings.definition: In a corrupt or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: He venally accepted the bribe without hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The politician acted venally by taking money under the table.
meanings.sent3: The detective venally accepted a donut as a bribe to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: The virus spread venally through the computer network, corrupting all the files.
meanings.sent5: The weeds venally took over the garden, choking out all the flowers.

meanings.definition: Capable of being bought or sold.
meanings.sent1: The venally acquired painting turned out to be a fake.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her venally obtained designer handbags.
meanings.sent3: The venally priced car seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: His venally gained wealth brought him no true happiness.
meanings.sent5: The venally traded stocks plummeted in value overnight.
